intro: Psychotria foxworthyi, commonly known as the Foxworth's psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in the undergrowth of rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
